metadata.title: CVE-2020-13775 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
ZNC 1.8.0 up to 1.8.1-rc1 allows authenticated users to trigger an application crash (with a NULL pointer dereference) if echo-message is not enabled and there is no network.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-13775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

znc - 1.8.1-1
znc-backlog - 1.8.1-1
znc-perl - 1.8.1-1
znc-push - 1.8.1-1
znc-python - 1.8.1-1
znc-tcl - 1.8.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: znc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-1').
